item.title: Help meh my class doesnt work!
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

Ah okay, my bad.
Thought something looked a bit suspicious.

Yeah, that’s all the problems nueb35, apart from the indenting…

[code]
import java.io.;
import java.lang.String;
import java.awt.;
import java.awt.event.;
import javax.swing.;

public class MakeCharFile extends JFrame implements ActionListener {

private static MakeCharFile frame;
private static JTextField playerName1;
private static JTextField playerPass1;	
public String playerPass = "";
public String playerName = "";

public void makeCharFile() {
	
	BufferedWriter bw = null;	
	try {		
		bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("chars/"+playerName+".java", true));
		bw.write("string "+playerName+"; string "+playerPass+";");
		bw.newLine();
		bw.flush();	
	} catch (IOException ioe) {
		ioe.printStackTrace();
	} finally {
		if (bw != null) try {
			bw.close();
		} catch (IOException ioe2) {
			System.out.println("Error");
		}
	}
}

public static void main(String[] args) {   
	MakeCharFile frame = new MakeCharFile();		
	frame.setTitle("Create a New Char.");
	frame.pack();
	frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
	frame.setVisible(true);
}

public MakeCharFile() {		
	setLayout(new GridLayout(4, 1));		
	JLabel JLabel1 = new JLabel("Enter Desired Username Below");
	playerName1 = new JTextField("Enter Username Here");
	JLabel JLabel3 = new JLabel("Enter Desired playerPass Below");
	playerPass1 = new JTextField("Enter playerPass Here");	
	add(JLabel1);
	add(playerName1);
	add(JLabel3);
	add(playerPass1);	
	playerName1.addActionListener(this);
	playerPass1.addActionListener(this);	
	makeCharFile();
}

public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
	JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(frame, "Account " + playerName1.getText() + 
			" With a playerPass of " + playerPass1.getText() + " Successfully Made!");
}

}[/code]
Another possible problem would be the fact that the private static variable ‘frame’ is never set to anything, but is referenced in the actionPerformed method.

MakeCharFile frame = new MakeCharFile();

Should beframe = new MakeCharFile();
If there’s something retarded about this post, ignore it - it’s 6am, and I’m ridiculously tired.

Read full topic
item.source: Help meh my class doesnt work!

item.title: Help meh my class doesnt work!
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

[quote=“Iamadam, post:7, topic:126587”][quote author=nueb35 link=topic=177202.msg1624659#msg1624659 date=1185267268]
sence u guys misse dthe HELP part i thought i would post it :\

[code]import java.io.;
import java.lang.String;
import java.awt.;
import java.awt.event.;
import javax.swing.;

public class MakeCharFile extends JFrame implements ActionListener
{
private static MakeCharFile frame;
private static JTextField playerName1;
private static JTextField playerPass1;

public String playerPass = "";
public String playerName = "";

public void makeCharFile()
{

BufferedWriter bw = null;

try {

bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("chars/"+playerName+".java", true));
bw.write("string "+playerName+"; string "+playerPass+";");
bw.newLine();
bw.flush();

} catch (IOException ioe) {
ioe.printStackTrace();
} finally {
if (bw != null) try {
bw.close();
} catch (IOException ioe2) {
System.out.println("Error");
	}
}

}

public static void main(String[] args)
{
MakeCharFile frame = new MakeCharFile();

frame.setTitle("Create a New Char.");
frame.pack();
frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
frame.setVisible(true);

}

public MakeCharFile()
{

setLayout(new GridLayout(4, 1));

JLabel JLabel1 = new JLabel("Enter Desired Username Below");
playerName1 = new JTextField("Enter Username Here");
JLabel JLabel3 = new JLabel("Enter Desired playerPass Below");
playerPass1 = new JTextField("Enter playerPass Here");

add(JLabel1);
add(playerName1);
add(JLabel3);
add(playerPass1);

playerName1.addActionListener(this);
playerPass1.addActionListener(this);

makeCharFile();

}

public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e)
{
JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(frame, “Account " + playerName1.getText() + " With a playerPass of " + playerPass1.getText() + " Successfully Made!”);
}
}[/code]
[/quote]
I do believe you forgot to fix the error…
There’s one too many closing braces in the actionPerformed method, javaNoob() =]
As I’m sure you are quite aware by now ;)[/quote]

i belive i didnt try runing that code… and tehre wasent 1 too many closing brackets just looks like it coz their in dif spots as u can see the “actionPerformed(ActionEvent e)” method needs to be closed wich is that bracket that u guys said doesent need to be there >.>

well if doing it for them dont help the ONLY errors i saw was :

playerName1.getText()

was

playerName.getText()

wich was declared as a String not a JTexField and Strings dont have the getText() method and

playerPass1.getText()

was

playerPass.getText

wich was declared also as a String and the getText was being used as a static variable instead of a public method ? am i correct?

Read full topic

[quote=“I Am Olan14, post:4, topic:126587”][code]import java.io.;
import java.lang.String;
import java.awt.;
import java.awt.event.;
import javax.swing.;

public class MakeCharFile extends JFrame implements ActionListener
{
private static MakeCharFile frame;
private static JTextField playerName1;
private static JTextField playerPass1;
private static JButton create;
public String playerPass = “”;
public String playerName = “”;

public void makeCharFile()
{

BufferedWriter bw = null;

try {
	
bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("chars/"+playerName+".java", true));
bw.write("string "+playerName+"; string "+playerPass+";");
bw.newLine();
bw.flush();

} catch (IOException ioe) {
ioe.printStackTrace();
} finally {
if (bw != null) try {
bw.close();
} catch (IOException ioe2) {
System.out.println("Error");
	}
}

}

public static void main(String[] args)
{
MakeCharFile frame = new MakeCharFile();

frame.setTitle("Create a New Char.");
frame.pack();
frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
frame.setVisible(true);

}

public MakeCharFile()
{

setLayout(new GridLayout(4, 1));

JLabel JLabel1 = new JLabel("Enter Desired Username Below");
playerName1 = new JTextField("Enter Username Here");
JLabel JLabel3 = new JLabel("Enter Desired playerPass Below");
playerPass1 = new JTextField("Enter playerPass Here");
JButton create = new JButton("Create Account");

add(JLabel1);
add(playerName1);
add(JLabel3);
add(playerPass1);
add(create);

// playerName1.addActionListener(this);
// playerPass1.addActionListener(this);

// makeCharFile();

}

public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent evt)
{
String cmd = evt.getActionCommand();

if(cmd.equals("create"))
{
makeCharFile();
JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(frame, "Account " + playerName.getText() + " With a playerPass of " + playerPass.getText + " Successfully Made!");
}

}
}
[/code][quote author=Evil_ link=topic=177202.msg1624505#msg1624505 date=1185261082]

public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) { JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(frame, "Account " + playerName.getText() + " With a playerPass of " + playerPass.getText + " Successfully Made!"); } }What’s wrong with that picture?
[/quote] I believe the question is what isn’t.[/quote]wtfrusayin…

public static void main(String[] args)

frame.setTitle("Create a New Char.");

if(cmd.equals("create"))

}

item.dc:creator: @javaNoob javaNoob()
item.description:
@javaNoob wrote:

[code]import java.io.;
import java.lang.String;
import java.awt.;
import java.awt.event.;
import javax.swing.;

public class MakeCharFile extends JFrame implements ActionListener
{
private static MakeCharFile frame;
private static JTextField playerName1;
private static JTextField playerPass1;

public String playerPass = "";
public String playerName = "";

public void makeCharFile()
{

BufferedWriter bw = null;

try {
	
bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("chars/"+playerName+".java", true));
bw.write("string "+playerName+"; string "+playerPass+";");
bw.newLine();
bw.flush();

} catch (IOException ioe) {
ioe.printStackTrace();
} finally {
if (bw != null) try {
bw.close();
} catch (IOException ioe2) {
System.out.println("Error");
	}
}

}

public static void main(String[] args)
{
MakeCharFile frame = new MakeCharFile();

frame.setTitle("Create a New Char.");
frame.pack();
frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
frame.setVisible(true);

}

public MakeCharFile()
{

setLayout(new GridLayout(4, 1));

JLabel JLabel1 = new JLabel("Enter Desired Username Below");
playerName1 = new JTextField("Enter Username Here");
JLabel JLabel3 = new JLabel("Enter Desired playerPass Below");
playerPass1 = new JTextField("Enter playerPass Here");

add(JLabel1);
add(playerName1);
add(JLabel3);
add(playerPass1);

playerName1.addActionListener(this);
playerPass1.addActionListener(this);

makeCharFile();

}

public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e)
{
JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(frame, “Account " + playerName.getText() + " With a playerPass of " + playerPass.getText + " Successfully Made!”);
}
}[/code]
